law.catch_line: Prohibition against operating commercial motor vehicle with inoperable, missing, or obscured lights or reflectors.

text.section:
As used in this section:
"Lights" means the lighting devices required on commercial vehicles having a declared gross weight in excess of ten thousand (10,000) pounds in accordance with 49 C.F.R. Part 393 and 49 C.F.R. Part 571; and
"Reflectors" means the reflex reflectors and retroflective sheeting required on commercial vehicles having a declared gross weight in excess of ten thousand (10,000) pounds in accordance with 49 C.F.R. Part 393.
A person shall not operate a commercial motor vehicle if the lights or reflectors are inoperable, missing, or are obscured by dirt, mud, or other debris.
Law enforcement officers shall enforce violations of this section.

law.history: Amended 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 85, sec. 280, effective June 26, 2007. -- Created 2001 Ky. Acts ch. 159, sec. 1, effective June 21, 2001.
